title: [Large-Scale] Computer Technology-Based Mathematical Problem-Solving and Social Decision-Making Competency Enhancement Project: Inquiry for Citizen Participation and Community Development

context.prior_knowledge: Basic arithmetic operations and understanding of simple algebraic expressions, general awareness of social phenomena (history, institutions, cultural diversity), experience with digital tools (data visualization, collaborative platforms)
context.additional_context: Customized learning environments using digital devices, project-based solving of real-life problems (e.g., environmental protection, public facility improvements), and community-linked activities to cultivate social responsibility (citizen participation, rights protection).

learning_goals: Learners solve real-world application problems (e.g., resource allocation, budget planning) with â‰¥80% accuracy using computer-based problem-solving systems and develop civic decision-making skills (citizen participation, policy evaluation) through data analysis

Learners improve their ability to apply mathematical concepts (probability, statistics) by one level or more using digital learning tools incorporating gamification elements and develop a sense of responsibility as citizens (community awareness, rights recognition) during collaborative problem-solving

Learners complete a math-based decision-making project (e.g., local traffic improvement plan) in collaboration with peers in a PBL environment and propose creative solutions (considering economic and cultural factors) for community problem-solving
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
